alert.note: Alert for Vieques (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 05 at 4:12PM AST until November 07 at 6:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of Puerto Rico and the United States Virgin Islands. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong mid to upper level trough centered north of Hispaniola, along with abundant moisture arriving from the Caribbean Sea has resulted in widespread showers and thunderstorms. The soils are saturated and rivers are running high, so urban, river and flash floods are likely to continue. Additionally, several mudslides have been reported. Over 5 inches of rain have been reported in Ponce, and 2 to 5 across southern Puerto Rico. These episodes of continuous rainfall will continue today and tomorrow.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
